translated: at that time the Tathāgata had this thought:

original: ngas kyang ma gnang la dge slong de dag kyang sman gzhan tshol bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i thabs ci yod snyam mo //
analyzed: ngas kyang ma gnang la dge slong de dag kyang sman gzhan tshol bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i thabs ci yod snyam mo //
translated: What means is there by which I may not give permission, yet those bhikṣus will not seek other medicines?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pas gnang du zin na ni /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pas gnang du zin na ni /
translated: If the Tathāgata were to give permission,

original: de'i phyir dus phyi ma la 'phags pa'i rigs nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir dus phyi ma la 'phags pa'i rigs nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, in the future, the lineage of the noble ones will be damaged.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thabs mkhas pas sman pa 'tsho byed kyi drung du me tog @97b autpa la'i bkru sman la mnams pa dang / de gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha'i bu rnams kyis dge slong dag la sbran te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thabs mkhas pas sman pa 'tsho byed kyi drung du me tog @97b autpa la'i bkru sman la mnams pa dang / de gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha'i bu rnams kyis dge slong dag la sbran te /
translated: the Tathāgata, skilled in means, pretended to smell the ointment of blue lotus flowers from the physician Jīvaka, and the gods of the Śuddhāvāsa realm warned the monks:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag /
translated: “Venerable ones,

original: 'chi ba'i dus ma byed par sman gzhan tshol cig ces byas pa dang / dge slong de dag gis bdag cag ni /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i dus ma byed par sman gzhan tshol cig ces byas pa dang / dge slong de dag gis bdag cag ni /
translated: do not die without seeking other medicine.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bslab pa las 'da' bar mi nus kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bslab pa las 'da' bar mi nus kyi /
translated: Those monks said, “We cannot transgress the training of the Tathāgata.

original: gum par gyur kyang rung gi /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i bslab pa las 'da' bar mi nus so //
analyzed: gum par gyur kyang rung gi / de bzhin gshegs pa'i bslab pa las 'da' bar mi nus so //
translated: Even if we die,

original: zhes smras so //
analyzed: zhes smras so //
translated: we cannot transgress the training of the Tathāgata.”

original: de nas gnas gtsang ma'i rigs kyi lha'i bu de dag gis dge slong de dag la de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi rje de nyid kyis kyang sman khu ba phyung ba ma gtogs par sman gzhan btsal na /
analyzed: de nas gnas gtsang ma'i rigs kyi lha'i bu de dag gis dge slong de dag la de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi rje de nyid kyis kyang sman khu ba phyung ba ma gtogs par sman gzhan btsal na /
translated: Then the gods of the pure abodes said to the monks, ‘Why do you not seek other medicines?

original: khyed ci'i phyir tshol bar mi sems /
analyzed: khyed ci'i phyir tshol bar mi sems /
translated: The Tathāgata, the Lord of the Dharma, has not prescribed any other medicine except for the nectar-like medicine.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag /
translated: Venerable ones,🔽seek other medicines.’

original: sman gzhan dag tshol cig ces de skad ces smras so; ;de nas dge slong lnga brgya po de dag gis 'gyod pa med par gyur te /
analyzed: sman gzhan dag tshol cig ces de skad ces smras so; ;de nas dge slong lnga brgya po de dag gis 'gyod pa med par gyur te /
translated: Then the five hundred monks, free of regret,

original: sman gzhan btsal ba dang / de dag nad de las yongs su thar par gyur te /
analyzed: sman gzhan btsal ba dang / de dag nad de las yongs su thar par gyur te /
translated: sought other medicines and were cured of their illness.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pas sman gzhan ma btang du zin na /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pas sman gzhan ma btang du zin na /
translated: if the Tathāgata had not prescribed other medicines,

original: gang dge slong de dag sman gzhan tshol bar 'gyur ba'i gnas med skabs med do //🔽nad de las yongs su thar par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: gang dge slong de dag sman gzhan tshol bar 'gyur ba'i gnas med skabs med do // nad de las yongs su thar par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: it would have been impossible for those monks to seek other medicines.🔽It would have been impossible for them to be cured of their illness

original: dgra bcom par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i gnas kyang med do //
analyzed: dgra bcom par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i gnas kyang med do //
translated: or to become arhats.

original: ci'i phyir na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bsod nams thams cad yang dag par 'phags pa bso @98a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bsod nams thams cad yang dag par 'phags pa bso @98a *//
translated: The Thus-Gone One, having risen above all merit,

original: snyoms kyi phyir grong du zhugs pa las lhung bzed ji ltar bkrus pa bzhin du slar byung zhe na /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa la las kyi sgrib pa ni /
analyzed: snyoms kyi phyir grong du zhugs pa las lhung bzed ji ltar bkrus pa bzhin du slar byung zhe na / de bzhin gshegs pa la las kyi sgrib pa ni /
translated: entered the town for alms, and his alms bowl returned as it was washed.

original: med mod kyi /
analyzed: med mod kyi /
translated: The Thus-Gone One has no karmic obscurations.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas phyi ma'i 'gro ba dag bsrung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas phyi ma'i 'gro ba dag bsrung ba'i phyir te /
translated: However, the Thus-Gone One did this to protect future beings.

original: dge slong gang la la zhig grong dang / grong rdal dang / pho brang dang / gang rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor du song ba las bdag gi bsod nams chung bas bsod snyoms ma rnyed na /
analyzed: dge slong gang la la zhig grong dang / grong rdal dang / pho brang dang / gang rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor du song ba las bdag gi bsod nams chung bas bsod snyoms ma rnyed na /
translated: If any monks, when entering a town, city, palace, or royal court, do not receive alms due to their own meager merit,

original: de'i tshe de dag de bzhin gshegs pa bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa nyid kyang lhung bzed ji ltar bkrus pa bzhin du slar byung na /
analyzed: de'i tshe de dag de bzhin gshegs pa bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa nyid kyang lhung bzed ji ltar bkrus pa bzhin du slar byung na /
translated: at that time, if the Thus-Gone One, who has accumulated the aggregate of merit, were to receive his alms bowl as it was washed,

original: bdag cag dge ba'i rtsa ba chung chu dang ldan pa lta ci smos te /
analyzed: bdag cag dge ba'i rtsa ba chung chu dang ldan pa lta ci smos te /
translated: what need is there to mention those who possess the roots of virtue?

original: bsod snyoms ma rnyed pa'i phyir yongs su gdung bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: bsod snyoms ma rnyed pa'i phyir yongs su gdung bar mi bya'o //
translated: He should not be distressed if he does not receive alms.

original: zhes de bzhin gshegs pa yid la byed par 'gyur ba'i don de gzigs nas de bzhin gshegs pa grong du gshegs nas lhung bzed ji ltar bkrus pa bzhin du byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes de bzhin gshegs pa yid la byed par 'gyur ba'i don de gzigs nas de bzhin gshegs pa grong du gshegs nas lhung bzed ji ltar bkrus pa bzhin du byung ngo //
translated: The Tathāgata, seeing this matter, which is to be attended to in the mind of the Tathāgata, went into the village and his bowl came back as it was washed.

original: yang bdud sdig can gyis bram ze dang / khyim bdag ci nas kyang bsod snyoms mi ster bar byin gyis brlabs so //
analyzed: yang bdud sdig can gyis bram ze dang / khyim bdag ci nas kyang bsod snyoms mi ster bar byin gyis brlabs so //
translated: Again, the evil Māra, in order to prevent the brahmins and householders from giving alms, blessed them.

original: zhes bya ba'ang de ltar mi blta'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'ang de ltar mi blta'o //
translated: You should not see it like that.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bdud ni / de bzhin gshegs pa la bsod snyoms kyi bar chad byed mi nus mod kyi /
analyzed: bdud ni / de bzhin gshegs pa la bsod snyoms kyi bar chad byed mi nus mod kyi /
translated: The evil Māra is not able to create an obstacle to the Tathāgata’s alms.

original: sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis bdud kyis bram ze dang / khyim bdag phyogs su byin gyis brlabs kyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis bdud kyis bram ze dang / khyim bdag phyogs su byin gyis brlabs kyi /
translated: Through the Buddha’s blessing, Māra blessed the brahmins and householders in that direction.

original: de bzhin gshegs @98b pa la ni; las kyi sgrib pa cung zad kyang med de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs @98b pa la ni; las kyi sgrib pa cung zad kyang med de /
translated: The Tathāgata has not the slightest karmic obscuration.

original: sems can de dag yongs su smin par rung ba'i phyir thabs mkhas pa ston to //🔽de la de bzhin gshegs pa bshos bcad pa dang / bdud dang bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams dang / lha gzhan dag dge sbyong goo ta ma'am /
analyzed: sems can de dag yongs su smin par rung ba'i phyir thabs mkhas pa ston to // de la de bzhin gshegs pa bshos bcad pa dang / bdud dang bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams dang / lha gzhan dag dge sbyong goo ta ma'am /
translated: He teaches skillful means so that those sentient beings may be ripened.🔽“There, the māras, the gods of the māra class, and other gods think, ‘The ascetic Gautama and his śrāvaka disciples are not dwelling unhappily, are they?

original: de'i nyan thos dag yid mi bde bar mi gnas grang zhes de bzhin gshegs pa nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa'i sems la rtog ste /
analyzed: de'i nyan thos dag yid mi bde bar mi gnas grang zhes de bzhin gshegs pa nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa'i sems la rtog ste /
translated: ’ They watch the minds of the Tathāgata and the community of śrāvakas.

original: de dag nyin mtshan du de bzhin gshegs pa nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa'i sems la brtags kyang sems kyi gnas gcig kyang yid mi bde bar ma mthong ste /
analyzed: de dag nyin mtshan du de bzhin gshegs pa nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa'i sems la brtags kyang sems kyi gnas gcig kyang yid mi bde bar ma mthong ste /
translated: Even though they watch the minds of the Tathāgata and the community of śrāvakas day and night, they do not see even one mental state that is unhappy.

original: ma khengs ma dud cing sngon ji lta ba phyis kyang de bzhin /
analyzed: ma khengs ma dud cing sngon ji lta ba phyis kyang de bzhin /
translated: They are not puffed up, not arrogant, and just as they were before, so they are afterwards;

original: phyis ji lta ba sngon yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: phyis ji lta ba sngon yang de bzhin no //
translated: just as they are afterwards, so they were before.

original: de nas de'i tshe lha'i bu bdun khri sems dad nas de bzhin gshegs pa la phyag btsal ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pas ci nas kyang de dag thams cad chos la chos kyi mig rnam par dag pa'i chos bshad de /
analyzed: de nas de'i tshe lha'i bu bdun khri sems dad nas de bzhin gshegs pa la phyag btsal ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pas ci nas kyang de dag thams cad chos la chos kyi mig rnam par dag pa'i chos bshad de /
translated: Then at that time, seventy thousand sons of gods, having given rise to faith, bowed to the Tathāgata, and the Tathāgata explained the Dharma in such a way that all of them purified the Dharma eye with regard to the Dharma.

original: de'ang de bzhin gshegs pa'i thabs mkhas pa yin gyi /🔽las kyi sgrib pa ni /
analyzed: de'ang de bzhin gshegs pa'i thabs mkhas pa yin gyi / las kyi sgrib pa ni /
translated: And that was the skillful means of the Tathāgata.

original: ma yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ma yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: You should know that it was not an obscuration of karma.

original: ci'i phyir na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bu mo tsan tsas shing gi gzhong pa lto ba la bcings nas skur pa ni; de bzhin gshegs pa la las kyi sgrib pa'i nyes pa gang yang med la /
analyzed: bu mo tsan tsas shing gi gzhong pa lto ba la bcings nas skur pa ni; de bzhin gshegs pa la las kyi sgrib pa'i nyes pa gang yang med la /
translated: The girl Cañcā tied a wooden bowl to her belly and slandered the Tathāgata, but the Tathāgata had no fault of obscuration of karma at all.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bu mo tsan tsa 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du 'phang yang @99a *//🔽nus mod kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bu mo tsan tsa 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du 'phang yang @99a *// nus mod kyi /
translated: The Tathāgata could have thrown the girl Cañcā to as many world systems as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thabs mkhas pas las kyi byed pa ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thabs mkhas pas las kyi byed pa ston to //
translated: but the Tathāgata, with skillful means, demonstrated the performance of karma.

original: bstan pa 'di la rab tu byung ba skur pa btab pa dag 'byung ste /
analyzed: bstan pa 'di la rab tu byung ba skur pa btab pa dag 'byung ste /
translated: In this teaching, there will be those who go forth and slander.

original: de dag mi bden par skur par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag mi bden par skur par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be denigrating what is not false.

original: de dag 'gyod pa tsam du gyur te skur pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa chos dkar po thams cad dang ldan pa de la'ang mngon sum du skur pa 'byung na /
analyzed: de dag 'gyod pa tsam du gyur te skur pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa chos dkar po thams cad dang ldan pa de la'ang mngon sum du skur pa 'byung na /
translated: They will be denigrating what is not false, and they will be denigrating the Thus-Gone One, who is endowed with all good qualities.

original: bdag cag lta ci'i phyir mi 'byung zhes smra zhing /
analyzed: bdag cag lta ci'i phyir mi 'byung zhes smra zhing /
translated: If they are denigrating him directly, why would they not denigrate us?

original: de dag de'i tshe skur pa zil gyis mnan nas yongs su dag pa yongs su dkar ba'i tshangs par spyod pa spyad par 'gyur gyi /🔽'bri bar ni /
analyzed: de dag de'i tshe skur pa zil gyis mnan nas yongs su dag pa yongs su dkar ba'i tshangs par spyod pa spyad par 'gyur gyi / 'bri bar ni /
translated: At that time, they will overcome their denigration and practice pure conduct that is completely pure and completely bright.

original: mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not diminish.

original: bu mo tsan tsa ni /
analyzed: bu mo tsan tsa ni /
translated: The girl Cañcā,

original: sdig pa'i las kyis g-yogs nas rmi lam na'ang de bzhin gshegs pa la skur pa 'debs pa de shi 'phos ma thag tu sems can dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdig pa'i las kyis g-yogs nas rmi lam na'ang de bzhin gshegs pa la skur pa 'debs pa de shi 'phos ma thag tu sems can dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: however, will be covered by her negative actions and will denigrate the Thus-Gone One even in her dreams. As soon as she dies and transmigrates, she will go to the hells.

original: de ste de bzhin gshegs pas de srung nus par mkhyen na ni /
analyzed: de ste de bzhin gshegs pas de srung nus par mkhyen na ni /
translated: If the Thus-Gone One knows that he can protect her,

original: de bsrungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bsrungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: he will protect her.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pas ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas ni /
translated: The Thus-Gone One

original: sems can gang yang yongs su btang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gang yang yongs su btang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no sentient being that is completely abandoned.

original: ci'i phyir na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: mdzes ma kun tu rgyu ba srog dang bral nas dze ta'i tshal du sbas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pas kyang g-yel bar phor zhe na /
analyzed: mdzes ma kun tu rgyu ba srog dang bral nas dze ta'i tshal du sbas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pas kyang g-yel bar phor zhe na /
translated: Why is it that when Sundarī the courtesan was about to die, she was hidden in Jetavana, and even the omniscient Tathāgata did not protect her?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
translated: The Tathāgata

original: thogs pa med pa'i ye shes dang ldan pas de 'dra bar 'gyur bar yang mkhyen @99b la de bzhin gshegs pas ci nas kyang mdzes ma kun tu rgyu ba mtshon gyis mi zug pa dang / gzhan du 'phang bar bya ba de lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul byin gyis brlabs kyang nus mos kyi /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa'i ye shes dang ldan pas de 'dra bar 'gyur bar yang mkhyen @99b la de bzhin gshegs pas ci nas kyang mdzes ma kun tu rgyu ba mtshon gyis mi zug pa dang / gzhan du 'phang bar bya ba de lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul byin gyis brlabs kyang nus mos kyi /
translated: knows that it will be like that because he possesses unobstructed knowledge. And although the Tathāgata is able to bless his magical power so that Sundarī the courtesan will not be pierced by the sword and will be thrown elsewhere,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mdzes ma kun tu rgyu tshe zad pas de nges par 'chi dgos la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mdzes ma kun tu rgyu tshe zad pas de nges par 'chi dgos la /
translated: the Tathāgata knows that Sundarī the courtesan will definitely die because her life is exhausted.

original: rnam grangs des kyang mu stegs can gzhan dag rang gis nyes pas shin tu tshar gcod par 'gyur par mkhyen te /
analyzed: rnam grangs des kyang mu stegs can gzhan dag rang gis nyes pas shin tu tshar gcod par 'gyur par mkhyen te /
translated: By this method, he also knows that other tīrthikas will be completely defeated by their own faults.

original: chos dkar po rnams 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir gang de bzhin gshegs pas byin gyis brlabs pa de ni /
analyzed: chos dkar po rnams 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir gang de bzhin gshegs pas byin gyis brlabs pa de ni /
translated: In order to increase the wholesome dharmas, he is the one who is blessed by the Tathagata.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes so //
translated: This is the wisdom of the Buddha.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhag bdun du grong du ma gshegs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhag bdun du grong du ma gshegs te /
translated: the Tathagata did not enter the city for seven days.

original: lha bye ba phrag drug cu'ang btul lo //
analyzed: lha bye ba phrag drug cu'ang btul lo //
translated: He also subdued six hundred million gods.

original: zhag bdun po de 'das nas 'khor bzhi bcom ldan 'das kyi drung du lhags nas de bzhin gshegs pas ci nas kyang srog chags brgyad khri bzhi stong gis ye shes rtogs par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar de dag la chos bshad do //
analyzed: zhag bdun po de 'das nas 'khor bzhi bcom ldan 'das kyi drung du lhags nas de bzhin gshegs pas ci nas kyang srog chags brgyad khri bzhi stong gis ye shes rtogs par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar de dag la chos bshad do //
translated: After those seven days had passed, the four assemblies came before the Bhagavan. The Tathagata explained the Dharma to them in such a way that eighty-four thousand beings realized wisdom.

original: ci'i phyir na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: de bzhin gshegs pas zla ba gsum rta'i chas kyi nas gsol ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas zla ba gsum rta'i chas kyi nas gsol ce na /
translated: Why did the Tathagata eat barley for three months?

original: de bzhin gshegs pas bram ze dang / khyim bdag 'di dag nga spyan drangs nas mi sems par 'gyur ro snyam du'ang mkhyen mod kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas bram ze dang / khyim bdag 'di dag nga spyan drangs nas mi sems par 'gyur ro snyam du'ang mkhyen mod kyi /
translated: The Tathagata knew that these brahmins and householders would not invite him if they thought he was eating barley.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas mkhyen bzhin du der tshul du bzhugs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas mkhyen bzhin du der tshul du bzhugs so //
translated: The Thus-Gone One knew this, and so he remained there in that manner.

original: ci'i phyir na /🔽gang rta lnga brgya po de dag gi chas la de bzhin gshegs pa dge slong gi dge @100a *//
analyzed: ci'i phyir na / gang rta lnga brgya po de dag gi chas la de bzhin gshegs pa dge slong gi dge @100a *//
translated: Why was that?

original: 'dun dang bcas pas zla ba gsum du gsol te /
analyzed: 'dun dang bcas pas zla ba gsum du gsol te /
translated: The Thus-Gone One and the saṅgha of monks were offered the provisions for those five hundred horses for three months.

original: rta de dag thams cad kyang byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la gnas pa sngon gyi rgyal pa la bsnyen bkur byas pa yin no /
analyzed: rta de dag thams cad kyang byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la gnas pa sngon gyi rgyal pa la bsnyen bkur byas pa yin no /
translated: All those horses were abiding in the vehicle of the bodhisattvas and had served past victors.

original: de dag sdig pa'i grogs pa'o dbang du song bas sdig pa'i las byas te /
analyzed: de dag sdig pa'i grogs pa'o dbang du song bas sdig pa'i las byas te /
translated: They had committed negative actions under the influence of evil companions.

original: de'i phyir byol song gi skye gnas su skyes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir byol song gi skye gnas su skyes so //
translated: Because of that, they were born in the animal realm.

original: rta lnga brgya po de dag gi nang na rta cang shes de ni /
analyzed: rta lnga brgya po de dag gi nang na rta cang shes de ni /
translated: Among those five hundred horses, the one that was a thoroughbred

original: byang chub sems dpa' nyi ma'i snying po zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nyi ma'i snying po zhes bya ba yin te /

original: par smra ba btang snyoms su bzhag gi /
analyzed: par smra ba btang snyoms su bzhag gi /
translated: Seeing this, the Thus-Gone One remained indifferent to the unpleasant words of the brahmin Bharadvāja.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la gang na'ang las kyi sgrib pa med de /🔽de'ang de bzhin gshegs pa'i thabs mkhas pa yin gyi; las kyi sgrib pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la gang na'ang las kyi sgrib pa med de / de'ang de bzhin gshegs pa'i thabs mkhas pa yin gyi; las kyi sgrib pa ni /
translated: The Thus-Gone One has no karmic obscurations whatsoever.

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: This is the Thus-Gone One’s skillful means, not karmic obscurations.

original: gang yang lha sbyin tshe rabs thams cad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rjes su 'brang bar 'gyur ba de yang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: gang yang lha sbyin tshe rabs thams cad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rjes su 'brang bar 'gyur ba de yang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs mkhas pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, Devadatta will follow the bodhisattva mahāsattvas in all his lives, and this too is the bodhisattva’s skillful means.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: ngas ni / lha sbyin la gnas te pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par gyur cing sems can dpag tu med pa'i don byas so //
analyzed: ngas ni / lha sbyin la gnas te pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par gyur cing sems can dpag tu med pa'i don byas so //
translated: I have perfected the six perfections based on Devadatta, and I have benefited countless beings.

original: rnam grangs gang gis she na /
analyzed: rnam grangs gang gis she na /
translated: In what way?

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: 'di la gang gi tshe sems can dag bde ba dang ldan par byas pa de'i tshe sbyin par yang mi shes /
analyzed: 'di la gang gi tshe sems can dag bde ba dang ldan par byas pa de'i tshe sbyin par yang mi shes /
translated: “When sentient beings are made happy, they do not know how to give,🔽nor do they know how to receive.

original: len par yang mi shes nas lha sbyin byang chub sems dpa'i gan du 'ongs te bu slong /
analyzed: len par yang mi shes nas lha sbyin byang chub sems dpa'i gan du 'ongs te bu slong /
translated: Then Devadatta came to the bodhisattva and asked for his son,

original: chung ma slong /
analyzed: chung ma slong /
translated: asked for his wife,

original: rgyal srid slong /
analyzed: rgyal srid slong /
translated: asked for his kingdom,

original: lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / mig dang / mgo dang / de la sogs pa gzhan dag kyang gang dka' bar spyod pa /
analyzed: lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / mig dang / mgo dang / de la sogs pa gzhan dag kyang gang dka' bar spyod pa /
translated: asked for his hands, feet, eyes, head, and so on, and asked for other things that were difficult to give.🔽When he asked for these things, which would cause sentient beings to generate roots of virtue, the bodhisattva did not become discouraged, but gave them.

original: sems can rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba skyed par byed pa dag slong nas byang chub sems dpa' ma zhum par gyur cing sbyin pa byed de; de mthong nas kyang sems can dpag tu med pa dag dga' zhing sbyin pa la mos par gyur te /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba skyed par byed pa dag slong nas byang chub sems dpa' ma zhum par gyur cing sbyin pa byed de; de mthong nas kyang sems can dpag tu med pa dag dga' zhing sbyin pa la mos par gyur te /
translated: Seeing this, countless sentient beings became happy and devoted to giving,

original: bdag cag kyang de 'dra bar gyur cig ces byang chub tu smon lam @103b 'debs shing tshul khrims 'dzin par byed de /
analyzed: bdag cag kyang de 'dra bar gyur cig ces byang chub tu smon lam @103b 'debs shing tshul khrims 'dzin par byed de /
translated: and they made aspirations for awakening, saying, ‘May we become like that!’ and they took up moral discipline.

original: gang tshul khrims 'dral bar 'dod pa dag kyang de nas byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims mi 'dral ba de mthong nas kyang sems can dpag tu med pa dag tshul khrims len par byed de /🔽brgyab bam / brdegs sam /
analyzed: gang tshul khrims 'dral bar 'dod pa dag kyang de nas byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims mi 'dral ba de mthong nas kyang sems can dpag tu med pa dag tshul khrims len par byed de / brgyab bam / brdegs sam /
translated: Also, those who wish to break the moral precepts, seeing that Bodhisattva not breaking the moral precepts, take up the moral precepts.🔽Even if they are struck, beaten, or scolded, they do not get angry, and they complete patience.

original: spyos kyang mi khro zhing de dag bzod pa rdzogs par 'gyur bas rnam grangs de'i phyir sems can dpag tu med pa'i don byas so //
analyzed: spyos kyang mi khro zhing de dag bzod pa rdzogs par 'gyur bas rnam grangs de'i phyir sems can dpag tu med pa'i don byas so //
translated: For this reason, he has done the work of immeasurable sentient beings.

original: gang yang lhas byin gyis de bzhin gshegs pa gsad par bshams pa dang / bal glang nor skyong btang ba dang / rdo'i sgyogs char btsugs pa de'ang de bzhin gshegs pa'i thabs mkhas par shes par bya'o //🔽las kyi sgrib pa'i nyon mongs pa ni /
analyzed: gang yang lhas byin gyis de bzhin gshegs pa gsad par bshams pa dang / bal glang nor skyong btang ba dang / rdo'i sgyogs char btsugs pa de'ang de bzhin gshegs pa'i thabs mkhas par shes par bya'o // las kyi sgrib pa'i nyon mongs pa ni /
translated: Also, Devadatta’s plotting to kill the Tathāgata, his sending Dhanapāla the elephant, and his setting up a rain of stones—all that should be known as the Tathāgata’s skillful means.

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: The afflictions are not karmic obstructions.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: thabs mkhas pa 'di la gnas nas sems can dpag tu med pa'i don byas so //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa 'di la gnas nas sems can dpag tu med pa'i don byas so //
translated: Dwelling in this skillful means, he has done the work of immeasurable sentient beings.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: mdor na lha sbyin grags par 'dod pa de ni /
analyzed: mdor na lha sbyin grags par 'dod pa de ni /
translated: In brief, Devadatta’s desire for fame

original: nga'i ston pa yin no //
analyzed: nga'i ston pa yin no //
translated: is my teacher.

original: las kyi rgyud bcu po thams cad kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i thabs mkhas par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: las kyi rgyud bcu po thams cad kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i thabs mkhas par shes par bya ste /
translated: “You should understand that all ten of these tantras are the skillful means of the Tathāgata.

original: las kyi bya ba shin tu ston pa'i sems can las kyi rnam par smin pa la mi 'jug pa'i sems can rnams la che ge mo zhig gi las kyi rnam par smin pa ni /
analyzed: las kyi bya ba shin tu ston pa'i sems can las kyi rnam par smin pa la mi 'jug pa'i sems can rnams la che ge mo zhig gi las kyi rnam par smin pa ni /
translated: For those beings who are engaged in the performance of actions but do not understand the ripening of karma, the Tathāgata, with skillful means, teaches the tantra of karma, saying,

original: 'di'o // che ge mo zhig gi las kyi rnam par smin pa ni /
analyzed: 'di'o // che ge mo zhig gi las kyi rnam par smin pa ni /
translated: ‘The ripening of such and such a karma is this,

original: 'di'o // zhes de bzhin gshegs pa thabs mkhas pas las kyi rgyud bstan te /
analyzed: 'di'o // zhes de bzhin gshegs pa thabs mkhas pas las kyi rgyud bstan te /
translated: and the ripening of such and such a karma is that.’

original: de thos nas phan pa byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de thos nas phan pa byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having heard this, they will act for their benefit.

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: rigs @104a *// kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs @104a *// kyi bu /
translated: son of noble family,

original: thabs mkhas pa bstan pa 'di gsang bar gyis shig /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa bstan pa 'di gsang bar gyis shig /
translated: you should keep this teaching on skillful means secret.

original: sems can dge ba'i rtsa ba chung du dang ldan pa rnams kyi mdun du ma 'chad cig /
analyzed: sems can dge ba'i rtsa ba chung du dang ldan pa rnams kyi mdun du ma 'chad cig /
translated: Do not teach it in front of beings with weak roots of virtue.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: bstan pa 'di ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'ang ma yin na /
analyzed: bstan pa 'di ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'ang ma yin na /
translated: This teaching is not even for the level of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas,

original: sems can dge ba'i rtsa ba chung du dang ldan pa rnams kyi lta ci smos //
analyzed: sems can dge ba'i rtsa ba chung du dang ldan pa rnams kyi lta ci smos //
translated: let alone for sentient beings with small roots of virtue.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dag thabs la bslabs pa ma yin pas 'di ni de dag la mi dgos so //
analyzed: de dag thabs la bslabs pa ma yin pas 'di ni de dag la mi dgos so //
translated: Because they have not trained in skillful means, so this is not necessary for them.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang dag bstan pa 'di la slob par 'gyur ba ma gtogs par gzhan thabs mkhas pa 'di'i snod du gyur pa gang yang med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang dag bstan pa 'di la slob par 'gyur ba ma gtogs par gzhan thabs mkhas pa 'di'i snod du gyur pa gang yang med do //
translated: There is no one else who is a suitable vessel for this skillful means, except for bodhisattvas who will train in this teaching.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: mtshan mo sa sros pa'i mun par mar me bus na /
analyzed: mtshan mo sa sros pa'i mun par mar me bus na /
translated: when a lamp is lit in the evening darkness in a house,

original: khyim na snod thams cad snang bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i yang thabs mkhas pa bstan pa 'di thos te mos par gyur nas sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa thams cad mthong bar 'gyur zhing sems can dag la'ang slob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyim na snod thams cad snang bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i yang thabs mkhas pa bstan pa 'di thos te mos par gyur nas sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa thams cad mthong bar 'gyur zhing sems can dag la'ang slob par 'gyur ro //
translated: all the vessels in the house become visible, and in the same way, when the bodhisattvas hear and believe in this teaching of skillful means, they will see all the practices of the buddhas and will also teach them to sentient beings.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: khyod la bsgo'o //
analyzed: khyod la bsgo'o //
translated: I will teach it to you.

original: khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: I will make it understood.

original: byang chub 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: byang chub 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: A son or daughter of good family who desires Awakening

original: rigs kyi bu mos thabs mkhas pa 'di gang na rnar grag par 'gyur na; dpag tshad 'bum du'ang 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mos thabs mkhas pa 'di gang na rnar grag par 'gyur na; dpag tshad 'bum du'ang 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: should go a hundred thousand leagues if they hear that this skillful means is being taught somewhere,

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: and why is that?

original: de ltar bstan pa 'di thos na snang ba thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar bstan pa 'di thos na snang ba thob par 'gyur /
translated: Because when they hear this teaching, they will attain illumination,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la 'gyod pa med par @104b 'gyur /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la 'gyod pa med par @104b 'gyur /
translated: they will have no regrets about any of the Buddha’s teachings,

original: the tshom dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: the tshom dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and they will be free from doubt.

original: de nas lha dang 'jig rten du bcas pa'i 'khor bzhi las sems can gang dag snod du gyur pa de dag gis ni chos kyi rnam grangs 'di thos so //
analyzed: de nas lha dang 'jig rten du bcas pa'i 'khor bzhi las sems can gang dag snod du gyur pa de dag gis ni chos kyi rnam grangs 'di thos so //
translated: Then, from among the four assemblies of gods and humans, those beings who were ready as vessels heard this Dharma teaching,

original: gang snod du ma gyur pa de dag gi ni rna lam du'ang mi grag go /
analyzed: gang snod du ma gyur pa de dag gi ni rna lam du'ang mi grag go /
translated: while those who were not ready as vessels did not hear it, even though it was being taught.

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bshad pa'i tshe srog chags bdun khri nyis stong gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bshad pa'i tshe srog chags bdun khri nyis stong gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
translated: When this Dharma discourse was taught, seventy-two thousand beings gave rise to the mind set on unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa dga' bos 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa dga' bos 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Nanda said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di'i ming ci lags /
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di'i ming ci lags /
translated: what is the name of this Dharma discourse?

original: 'di ji ltar gzung bar bgyi /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar gzung bar bgyi /
translated: How should it be remembered?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: dga' bo / chos kyi rnam grangs 'di ni thabs mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bstan par zungs shig /
analyzed: dga' bo / chos kyi rnam grangs 'di ni thabs mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bstan par zungs shig /
translated: “Nanda, you should remember this Dharma discourse as the Teaching on the Perfection of Skillful Means.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi thabs mkhas pa'i gsang ba'i le'ur zungs shig ces bcom ldan 'das dgyes shing de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / dga' bo dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ye shes bla ma dang / lha dang / mi dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi thabs mkhas pa'i gsang ba'i le'ur zungs shig ces bcom ldan 'das dgyes shing de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / dga' bo dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ye shes bla ma dang / lha dang / mi dang /
translated: You should remember it as the Chapter on the Secret Skillful Means of All Buddhas.” When the Blessed One joyfully spoke these words, Nanda, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Jñānāgrya, gods, humans,

original: lha ma yin dang / dri zar bcas pa'i 'jig rten rnams bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa la mngon par dga'o //
analyzed: lha ma yin dang / dri zar bcas pa'i 'jig rten rnams bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa la mngon par dga'o //
translated: the world of the asuras, and the world of the gandharvas rejoiced in the Blessed One’s words.

original: thabs mkhas pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo rdzogs so ////
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo rdzogs so ////
translated: This concludes the Mahāyāna sūtra “Skillful Means.”

original: shlo ka drug brgya ste bam po gnyis ////
analyzed: shlo ka drug brgya ste bam po gnyis ////
translated: Six hundred verses. Two fascicles.
